edge: Deadpool is a character from the Marvel Comics.
Tim Miller directed the film Deadpool.
Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick wrote the screenplay for Deadpool.
Deadpool is distributed by 20th Century Fox.
Deadpool is a spin-off of the X-Men film series.
Ryan Reynolds plays the title role in Deadpool.
Morena Baccarin appears in Deadpool alongside Ryan Reynolds.
Ed Skrein appears in Deadpool as the villain.
T.J. Miller has a role in Deadpool.
Gina Carano appears in Deadpool.
Brianna Hildebrand plays a character named Negasonic Teenage Warhead in Deadpool.
The majority of filming for Deadpool took place during principal photography, which lasted from March to May 2015 in Vancouver, British Columbia.
Deadpool is the main character of the Marvel Comics.
Wade Wilson assumes the role of Deadpool in the film.
Deadpool is based on the Marvel Comics character of the same name.
Fox granted a greenlight to produce Deadpool in 2014.
The film Deadpool was released on February 12, 2016.
Deadpool held its premiere in Paris on February 8, 2016.
Deadpool is the vigilante alter ego of Wade Wilson.
In an expressway ambush, Deadpool targets Ajax and his men.
Wade Wilson falls in love with Vanessa.
Vanessa accepts Wade Wilson's marriage proposal.
Wade Wilson previously served in the Canadian special forces.
The experimental treatment transformed Wade Wilson into Deadpool.
After being dishonorably discharged from the Canadian special forces, Wade Wilson becomes a freelance mercenary.
In the film, Deadpool faces off against the formidable villain Ajax.
Wade Wilson meets a sex worker named Vanessa.
The film featuring Deadpool was critically acclaimed.
Wade Wilson is diagnosed with terminal cancer.
The film featuring Deadpool was an R-rated film.
Some critics criticized the plot of the film featuring Wade Wilson as formulaic.
The film featuring Deadpool broke the record for highest-grossing R-rated film at the time.
The film featuring Deadpool became the highest-grossing film in the X-Men series.
Wade leaves Vanessa so she will not have to watch him die.
Ajax and Angel Dust take Wade to their laboratory and subject him to days of torture to trigger any mutation, but to no avail.
Ajax and Angel Dust run a laboratory where they inject Wade with a serum designed to awaken latent mutant genes in his body.

Discovering Ajax's real name is Francis and mocking him for it, Ajax leaves Wade in a hypobaric chamber that periodically takes him to the verge of asphyxiation over a weekend. This activates a regenerative healing factor that counteracts Wade's cancer but leaves him severely disfigured with tumor-like scars all over his body.
When Wade escapes from the chamber and attacks Ajax but relents when told his condition can be cured, Ajax subdues Wade and leaves him for dead.
Wade adopts the name 'Deadpool' and becomes a vigilante, seeking out Ajax for the cure due to his new healing factor and fear of rejection from Vanessa.
Wade seeks out Vanessa but does not reveal his true identity due to fear of her rejecting him because of his new scarred appearance.
Weasel picks Wade in a dead pool and helps him consult about hunting down Ajax for the cure.
Wade moves into the home of an elderly blind woman named Al.
Deadpool questions and kills many of Ajax's associates throughout the following year.
One of Ajax's associates reveals Ajax's whereabouts to Deadpool.
Colossus attempts to convince Deadpool to join the X-Men and mend his ways.
Colossus' trainee Negasonic Teenage Warhead interrupts Deadpool while he is demanding the cure from Ajax.
Angel Dust regroups with Ajax after he escapes and hears of Vanessa.
Ajax kidnaps Vanessa and takes her to a decommissioned Helicarrier in a scrapyard.
In response, Wade convinces Colossus and Negasonic to help him get her back.
Angel Dust and a group of Ajax’s men while Wade fights his way to Ajax.
Battle Angel Dust and a group of Ajax’s men while Wade fights his way to Ajax.
Carries Negasonic and Angel Dust to safety during the battle.
Protects Vanessa as the ship collapses around them, while Colossus carries Negasonic and Angel Dust to safety.
Attacks Wade again but is overpowered.
Takes Vanessa to a decommissioned Helicarrier in a scrapyard.
Accidentally destroys the supports keeping the Helicarrier stable during the battle.
Reconciles with her after she sees his disfigured face and learns the reason why he never came back to her.
Reveals that a cure never existed.
Stefan Kapičić is the actor who provides the voice and Russian accent for the character Colossus in the movie.
Colossus's entire body can transform into organic steel.
Writer Rhett Reese describes Colossus as a 'great foil to Deadpool' because of his seriousness and virtuous nature.

In previous film appearances, Colossus was portrayed by Daniel Cudmore, but director David Leitch wanted a drastically different version of the character due to his previous portrayal being 'not Colossus'.
Director David Leitch described the previous version of Colossus, played by Daniel Cudmore, as having 'shiny skin'.

Leslie Uggams portrays Blind Al, an elderly blind woman and Deadpool's roommate. Blind Al has 'been through British Intelligence, she's done all kinds of wild and crazy things ... she's old, but she's feisty.'
Leslie Uggams portrays Blind Al, an elderly blind woman and Deadpool's roommate. Leslie Uggams said that Al has 'a love/hate' relationship with Deadpool.'
Karan Soni appears as Dopinder, a taxi driver who befriends Deadpool.
Jed Rees portrays a recruiter for Ajax.
Stan Lee and Deadpool co-creator Rob Liefeld make cameo appearances as a strip club emcee and a patron of Weasel's bar, respectively.

Rob Hayter makes a cameo appearance as Bob, Agent of Hydra. The rights for Bob are owned by Marvel Studios. They did not give permission for him to be used in the film, so his comic history and connections to the Hydra organization are not referenced in the film. He is explained, instead, as a former special-forces operative like Wilson.

node_2: people magazine sexiest man alive cover
edge: Hugh Jackman, who portrayed Logan / Wolverine in the X-Men film series, was very supportive of Deadpool and it making fun of himself and his character. He is seen in the film on a People magazine Sexiest Man Alive cover.
A scene featuring Nathan Fillion as a bathroom attendant was cut, but was included in the deleted scenes of the home media release.
Artisan Entertainment announced a deal with Marvel Entertainment in May 2000 to co-produce, finance, and distribute several films based on Marvel Comics' characters, including Deadpool.
Deadpool is a character from Marvel Comics'
Writer and director David S. Goyer and Ryan Reynolds were working on a Deadpool film at New Line Cinema.
Reynolds was interested in the part of Deadpool after learning that in the comics the character refers to his appearance as "Ryan Reynolds crossed with a Shar-Pei".
There were rights issues with 20th Century Fox and their X-Men films, and the project did not move forward.
New Line Cinema executive Jeff Katz championed the idea of Reynolds playing Deadpool.
By March 2005, Reynolds learned that Fox had expressed interest in a film featuring Deadpool.
The character was set to make a cameo appearance in the 2009 film X-Men Origins: Wolverine, with Reynolds cast in the part.
After the successful opening weekend of Wolverine, Fox officially began development on Deadpool, with Reynolds attached to star and X-Men producer Lauren Shuler Donner involved.
The spinoff was set to ignore the Wolverine version of Deadpool and return to the character's roots.
The spinoff was set to have a slapstick tone.
The spinoff had a 'propensity to break the fourth wall'.
were hired to write the script in January 2010.
Ryan Reynolds said about their understanding of Deadpool in January 2010.
was asked to direct the film in June 2010 but was no longer interested by October 2011.

was hired as director in April 2011 because of his work creating animated short films, including 'Gopher Broke' and a DC Universe Online trailer, which were 'epic and cinematic, everything [Fox wanted] their comic book movies to be'.
closed a deal with Fox in April 2011 to produce 'Deadpool' after working closely with Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick.
Ryan Reynolds plays the role of Deadpool in the movie. The success and popularity of the test footage featuring Reynolds as Deadpool ultimately led to the film's production.
The movie Deadpool was released on February 12, 2016, due to the green-lighting by Fox.
The test footage of Deadpool was leaked online in July 2014.
The leaked test footage received an overwhelmingly enthusiastic response.
Simon Kinberg joined the production team of Deadpool as a producer in September 2014.
Due to the popularity generated by the leaked test footage, Fox green-lit the production of Deadpool in September 2014.
Reynolds initially thought that Ryan Reynolds himself leaked the test footage, but later believed that it was someone at Fox who did so.

node_2: smaller budget than typical for superhero films
edge: In exchange for being able to make the film the way they wanted, Fox gave the crew a much smaller budget than is typical for superhero films.
set in the same shared universe as the X-Men films, but would 'stand independently'
added as a trainee X-Men mentored by Colossus
traditional X-Man in the film as a foil to Deadpool and felt Colossus was a character who had not been explored much in previous films
The writers worked to keep the script's pop-culture references up-to-date throughout its development.
Kinberg confirmed the film would make fun of Deadpool's portrayal in X-Men Origins: Wolverine.
The film includes jokes at the expense of Green Lantern.
Miller felt it was okay for audience members not to understand all of the film's jokes, but he wanted to avoid anything targeted specifically at comic fans.
The film's post-credits scene is a parody of the equivalent scene from Ferris Bueller's Day Off (1986).
Deadpool wears a bath robe and tells the audience to go home in the parody scene, and he also confirms that Cable will appear in the sequel.
After reading the scene, a Fox executive described the film as a combination of Ferris Bueller's Day Off and Natural Born Killers (1994), a description the writers felt was accurate.

Forty-eight hours before the film received the official green light from Fox, the studio cut its budget by $7–$8 million down to $58 million. This forced a last minute re-write that saw about nine pages cut from the 110-page script.
The script was very efficient and not too long. That was a function of budget more than anything, but I think it really made the movie pace nicely.
Miller was confirmed for an unspecified role.
In January 2015, T.J. Miller and Ed Skrein were in talks to appear in the film, with Miller as "an additional comic voice"
Carano was cast as Angel Dust.

edge: In January 2015, Fox was testing actresses to portray the female lead, including Morena Baccarin, Taylor Schilling, Crystal Reed, Rebecca Rittenhouse, Sarah Greene, and Jessica De Gouw.
Baccarin was cast as Deadpool's love interest before the end of February.
Cudmore said he would not be reprising the role for Deadpool.
An immediate focus during pre-production was Deadpool's suit. Comic book art is fairly over the top in terms of physique.

node_2: faithful comic book to movie adaptation fans have ever seen
edge: we fought like hell... To make this the most faithful comic book to movie adaptation fans have ever seen.
Russ Shinkle and Film Illusions were hired to create the costume. Shinkle noted that 'comic book art is fairly over the top in terms of physique', and he tried to balance that with reality.
An immediate focus during pre-production was Deadpool's suit.
The costume was difficult for the visual effects team to replicate with CGI. Visual effects supervisor Jonathan Rothbart blamed this on the suit's fabric.
The suit was designed with the film's stunts in mind. The mask's eye areas were removable so versions of the eyes better suited for the stunts could be used without having to change the whole mask.
Film Illusions made six hero versions of the costume and twelve stunt-specific versions

node_1: grittier and less clean and glossy
edge: Tim Miller and cinematographer Ken Seng wanted the film to have this style in comparison to other superhero films.
Miller and Seng added film grain to the images captured with digital cameras during post-production to give the images texture.
Seng used these specific types of lenses for the origin story timeline.
These lenses were used by Seng for the Deadpool scenes because they provided more clarity.

This consistent aesthetic was achieved in exterior scenes due to location shooting with unpredictable weather. Seng used more lighting on cloudy days and less on sunny days to maintain this appearance.
The production designer worked closely with Miller to implement his concepts while conserving the budget for visual effects by being highly specific about which elements of each set were constructed.
Some garbage was physically built in the scene and later extended with CGI.
These elements were used during filming of the final sequence, which took place in a naval yard dressed with scrap metal.
When Fox was unwilling to pay Reese and Wernick to be on set every day, Reynolds paid their salaries.
The writers had scripted the action very specifically, but Tim Miller and the stunt coordinators were free to change this.
Robert Alonzo and Philip J. Silvera were the film's stunt coordinators;
The stunt team had a month before filming began to prepare the actors.
Skrein worked 'nonstop' to prepare.
He said Reynolds 'has a photographic memory; he'd do something three or four times and remember it very well.'
The actors often came up with around 15 alternate jokes for each one in the script, and were generally only limited to those because of time constraints.
For example, Reese said Wernick had written some jokes for the scene where Deadpool visits Colossus and Negasonic. Instead Reynolds improvised the line on set,
This was based in truth and became then Fox chairman Jim Gianopulos' favorite line.
Filming ended on May 29.
Leslie Uggams played the role of Blind Al in the film in July 2015.
Tim Miller stated that Jed Rees portrayed 'The Recruiter' and did a good job of being creepy and syrupy sweet.
Andre Tricoteux provided motion reference on set for the role of Colossus along with the voice.
Stefan Kapičić took over the role of Colossus in December after the voice was recast.
Jokes made by Deadpool after Vanessa is kidnapped were removed because they felt inappropriately timed and took too long to recover from.
Tim Stipan colored Deadpool with a 'dark, modern touch' during color grading.
Tim Stipan gave Colossus a 'particular vibrancy and substance' during color grading.

One sequence removed from the film saw Wilson and Vanessa travel to Mexico looking for a cure after he turned down the recruiter. This scene implies that in its new context, Deadpool is re-thinking the offer of the recruiter due to his current health condition and search for a cure in Mexico.
Because of the animation required for Deadpool's mask and Colossus, Reynolds had more freedom than usual to keep adjusting the script during post-production.
Reynolds recorded new dialogue using his iPhone for the film.
Another where Deadpool asks whether Professor X is being portrayed by James McAvoy or Patrick Stewart at that point in the X-Men timeline.

Digital Domain, a company that specializes in visual effects, played a significant role in producing the visual effects for Deadpool. This highlights the importance of visual effects companies in bringing to life the visually stunning sequences in films.

Digital Domain and Atomic Fiction, both renowned visual effects companies, contributed to Deadpool's visual effects. This connection suggests that these two companies have collaborated in the past or might do so in future projects.

Digital Domain, Atomic Fiction, and Blur Studio were all involved in producing Deadpool's visual effects. This indicates that these companies have worked together on other projects as well or might do so in the future.

Digital Domain, along with Weta Digital, played a significant role in producing Deadpool's visual effects. This relationship implies that these two companies might have collaborated on other projects as well.
Digital Domain and Rodeo FX were both part of the team that worked on Deadpool's visual effects. This suggests that these two companies have collaborated on other projects or might do so in future.
Digital Domain, along with Luma Pictures, contributed to Deadpool's visual effects. This relationship implies that these two companies might have collaborated on other projects as well.
Director Tim Miller played a significant role in designing and completing the film's visual effects, which highlights his expertise in visual effects production.

Miller held off working on the CGI for Colossus until after the film was edited to avoid spending money on shots that would not be used. This shows Miller's attention to detail and cost-effectiveness in visual effects production.

Visual effects supervisor Jonathan Rothbart collaborated with Miller to design and complete the film's 1500 visual effects shots. This emphasizes the importance of effective collaboration between the director and visual effects team.

The movements of Colossus in the movie were re-recorded by T.J. Storm as Tricoteux was unable to move athletically due to platform shoes he wore on set. This is because Tricoteux's height had to be replicated for the character.
LaSalle was used for the facial performance of Colossus in the movie.
DD mapped the performances of T.J. Storm and LaSalle onto a digital model designed to be comic-accurate for Colossus.
The team visited a metal company to look at samples to avoid looking 'chromey' for Colossus's metallic finish in the movie.
The team used hot rolled steel to replicate Colossus's hair as part of his metallic finish in the movie.
DD created the digital model for Deadpool used by all the FX vendors in the movie.
The team animated Deadpool's mask around the eyes to be expressive as in the comics, which helped balance out the 'chinwag' coming through the bottom of the mask as Reynolds acted.
Fully replacing Deadpool's head was too costly, so Weta Digital warped each shot based on facial references from Reynolds and adjusted the lighting to reflect the changes instead.
Atomic Fiction created a freeway environment for the Twelve Bullets Fight, with a backdrop based on Detroit.
Atomic Fiction created a freeway environment for the Twelve Bullets Fight, with a backdrop based on Detroit and Chicago.
Atomic Fiction created a freeway environment for the Twelve Bullets Fight, with a backdrop based on Detroit, Chicago, and Vancouver.
These assets were used by Blur for the opening titles, which move through a frozen moment where Deadpool is fighting thugs inside a crashing car.
Reynolds, Miller, and the writers came up with their own credits hoping to set the tone for the film.
DD did not want to be "outdone" by Luma and had "buckets of blood pouring out". Luma created the regrowing hand, inspired by the hand of a fetus.
DD went through 20 or 30 different versions of what broken fingers could look like.
Rodeo FX referenced rotting fruit and maggot-eaten meat for Deadpool's initial scarring from the warehouse fire.
Rodeo FX augmented the practical fire in the scene.
The company added a CGI penis to Reynolds in this sequence, which visual effects supervisor Wayne Brinton said, "you don't even notice [but] when it wasn't there it looked really weird".
Luma created the climactic fight between Deadpool and Ajax
DD created the effects for Negasonic Teenage Warhead's abilities as well as expanding the helicarrier's deck
DD created most of the Colossus effects until he is damaged when Blur Studio took over
The vendors all collaborated for the final battle sequence, which takes place in the wreckage of a helicarrier
Rodeo contributed matte paintings for the background
Weta provided the facial animation for Deadpool
These terms were the only 'supernatural effect-sy thing' in the film, and were based on fuel-air explosives and solar flares to try to ground them in reality.
To avoid rights issues with Marvel Studios, the helicarrier for Deadpool was designed to be 'as different as possible from the one in The Avengers'
A French animation artist with a 'unique style' created 2D cartoon characters that dance around Deadpool after he is stabbed in the head during the fight.

Due to the film's limited marketing budget, Reynolds worked closely with Fox's marketing chief Marc Weinstock to use the Internet to their advantage and come up with cheaper, 'Deadpool-based' ways to market the film.
Reynolds kept one of the Deadpool costumes for himself, and appeared in it throughout the marketing campaign.
Visual effects vendor Image Engine animated Deadpool's mask for these appearances, using a process similar to that used by Weta Digital for the film.
Deadpool's world premiere was held at the Grand Rex in Paris on February 8, 2016,

The film was released in several formats, including IMAX, DLP, premium large formats, and D-Box. The initial theatrical release in Hong Kong was on February 9, 2016, followed by releases in 49 other markets over the next few days, including the United States on February 12.
Emma Grey Ellis at Wired.com described the campaign as 'crazy and unrelenting' with Deadpool waging a 'marketing siege of every platform you would think of'.
Bobby Anhalt at Screen Rant called it possibly 'the best film marketing campaign in the history of cinema'.
HostGator's Jeremy Jensen attributed the campaign's success to Reynolds, and to Fox for embracing the film's R rating.

Kinberg explained that unlike the previous X-Men films, Deadpool is 'a hard R. It's graphic. Nothing is taboo.' This rating is crucial to the film's nature and tone as Kinberg stated, indicating that without it, the movie would not be 'truly outrageous boundary-pushing kind of movie.'
Kinberg further explained that 'nothing is taboo' in the film, highlighting its unconventional and explicit content.
The country forbade the film's release due to its hard R rating as it was deemed impossible to edit without affecting the plot. This decision suggests a stricter content censorship policy in China.
Theater owners in Uzbekistan decided against showing Deadpool due to its age restriction and societal norms violation. This implies the country's conservative social standards.
The film received seven 'general cuts' to obtain approval for release in India, indicating a more lenient censorship policy in the country but still requiring some edits.

Despite being blocked during its initial release in China, Deadpool eventually premiered at the festival without any edits being made for Chinese censors, suggesting that the film's content may have been deemed acceptable by the event organizers.
Deadpool was released for digital download on April 26, 2016.
The physical home media release came on May 10.
Behind-the-scenes featureettes were included in the latter release for Blu-ray and DVD.
Deleted scenes were included in the latter release for Blu-ray and DVD.
A blooper reel was included in the latter release for Blu-ray and DVD.
One audio commentary was by Tim Miller and Deadpool co-creator Rob Liefeld.
Another audio commentary was by Ryan Reynolds, Rhett Reese, and Paul Wernick.
On November 7, Fox rereleased the film and its special features on Blu-ray for the holiday season.
A 4K UHD Steelbook version was also released exclusively through Best Buy featuring original artwork.

After spending 126 days in theaters, Deadpool's domestic run ended on June 17.
During its domestic box office run, Deadpool grossed $363.1 million.
Deadpool's domestic run ended on June 17, after becoming the highest-grossing R-rated comic book superhero film.
In nine days, Deadpool became the highest-grossing X-Men film.
The following day after becoming the highest-grossing R-rated comic book superhero film, Deadpool's domestic run remained in the No. 1 position.
However, after three weeks, Deadpool fell behind Zootopia.
The following week, Deadpool also fell behind London Has Fallen.
The film had a successful run at the international box office, grossing $216.9 million in its first two weekends.
The film was released in 80 markets around the world, many of them in its first week.
The film was released in the United Kingdom on its first day (February 9).
The film was also released in France on its first day (February 9).
Similarly, the film was launched in Australia on its first day (February 9) and became the No. 1 film.
The film also opened well in Taiwan, where Reynolds had traveled for promotion and made the "central hub" of South East Asia for the film.
In Hong Kong, the film set a new record for biggest Chinese New Year single day opening ever.
However, in Poland and Malaysia, the film was No. 2 behind local films Planet Single and The Mermaid, respectively.
The film broke the record for biggest opening weekend in Russia.
It also set a new record for biggest opening weekend in Thailand.
The film's $9 million IMAX showings set opening weekend records for February releases and R-rated films in several markets.
The film also broke the record for biggest R-rated film at the international box office.
In South East Asia, Deadpool's performance was compared favorably to that of Guardians of the Galaxy, which also released in 2014.
In South East Asia, Deadpool's performance was compared favorably to that of Captain America: The Winter Soldier, which also released in 2014.
On review aggregator Rotten Tomatoes, the film holds an approval rating of 85% based on 348 reviews, with an average rating of 7.1/10.

The site's critical consensus reads, "Fast, funny, and gleefully profane, the fourth-wall-busting Deadpool subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining—and decidedly non-family-friendly—results."[140]
subverts superhero film formula with wildly entertaining—and decidedly non-family-friendly—results.

Audiences polled by CinemaScore gave the film an average grade of 'A' on an A+ to F scale.

with 45% of filmgoers saying the film exceeded their expectations.

The film 'Deadpool' gets off to a fun start, but the character eventually wears out his welcome according to Kenneth Turan's review in Los Angeles Times.
Though the film 'Deadpool' has a complicated narrative, it is masking a conventional Marvel origin story according to Kenneth Turan's review in Los Angeles Times.
Kenneth Turan highlighted the film's romantic element featuring Deadpool in his review for Los Angeles Times.
In his review for Los Angeles Times, Kenneth Turan noted Baccarin's outstanding performance in the film's romantic element.
According to Robbie Collin's review for The Daily Telegraph, some of the film's jokes about superhero cliches were out of date by the time the film was released.
Mick LaSalle stated in his review for San Francisco Chronicle that the film's 'fake-clever awfulness' is 'just the kind of future cinema's might be.'
The film 'Deadpool' has received many awards and nominations, recognizing the film as a whole.
Particularly Reynolds as Deadpool, the cast's performance in 'Deadpool' has been recognized and nominated for awards.
The film's makeup, sound, and visual effects are some of the technical areas that 'Deadpool' has been recognized and nominated for awards.
'Deadpool' was nominated for two Golden Globe Awards.
The film 'Deadpool' received four nominations from the Critics' Choice Movie Awards, winning two.
'Deadpool' was nominated for a Directors Guild of America Award.
The film 'Deadpool' received five nominations from the Empire Awards.
'Deadpool' won two Golden Trailer Awards for its marketing campaign.
The film 'Deadpool' was nominated for a Hugo Award.
The marketing campaign for 'Deadpool' won two Key Art Awards.
'Deadpool' received eight nominations from the MTV Movie Awards, winning two.
'Deadpool' was nominated for a Producers Guild of America Award.
The film 'Deadpool' won two People's Choice Awards.
'Deadpool' received a nomination from the Saturn Awards, winning one.
'Deadpool' won two Teen Choice Awards.

After being nominated for awards such as the Golden Globes, Critics' Choice, and Writers Guild of America, Deadpool was considered a serious contender by commentators for several Academy Awards. This included potential nominations for Best Adapted Screenplay and Best Makeup and Hairstyling, and after its Producers Guild of America nomination, Best Picture. However, when the film did not receive any Academy Award nominations, it was widely considered to have been 'snubbed'.

Some commentators have noted an apparent bias that Academy voters have against superhero films, which may explain why Deadpool did not receive any nominations despite being nominated for several other awards.
The lack of a targeted campaign for the awards by Fox, who did not seem to be expecting any of the film's previous awards either, may have also contributed to Deadpool's snubbing by the Academy.
Additionally, the number of other highly-acclaimed films in contention that year may have made it difficult for Deadpool to secure a nomination.

Furthermore, some commentators have suggested that while the film earned a solid thumbs up from most, it was generally not praised by top critics for offering any 'depth or related subversion of its genre'.
Before Deadpool's success, R-rated, comic-based films with moderate success include 300 which earned about half the opening weekend gross of successful PG-13 superhero films.
Before Deadpool's success, R-rated, comic-based films with moderate success include Watchmen which earned about half the opening weekend gross of successful PG-13 superhero films.
Tonally similar R-rated film Kick-Ass made even less with a $19.8 million opening compared to Deadpool's success.
The popularity of the Marvel brand is given as one reason for Deadpool's more successful outcome compared to earlier R-rated, comic-based films.

Tom Huddleston Jr. wrote for Fortune that Deadpool was proof to Hollywood that R-rated films can be as successful as PG-13 films, 'particularly when fans see the rating itself as validation that the film is true to its source material'.

After the proposed acquisition of 21st Century Fox by Disney was announced in December 2017, Disney CEO Bob Iger said that the company would be willing to make future R-rated Marvel films like Deadpool, potentially under a 'Marvel-R' brand, 'as long as we let the audiences know what's coming'. This indicates that there is a potential branding for future R-rated Marvel films called 'Marvel-R', and Deadpool falls under this category.

Following the acquisition of 21st Century Fox by Disney, the character's film rights were returned to Marvel Studios alongside the X-Men and the Fantastic Four. This suggests that Disney now holds the film rights for Deadpool.

Deadpool & Wolverine, a third film starring Reynolds and Hugh Jackman and integrating their characters into the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), was released on July 26, 2024, as part of Phase Five of the MCU. This indicates that Deadpool will be integrated into the wider MCU in Phase Five.
In March 2017, a Warner Bros. Executive said that an R-rated DC Extended Universe film could 'absolutely' happen. This suggests that there is potential for an R-rated DC Extended Universe film.

In June, Kevin Feige said in response to the successes that, though Marvel Studios was not planning any R-rated films for its Marvel Cinematic Universe, 'it's not out of the question'. This implies that Sony Pictures is considering developing an R-rated adaptation of the character Venom with a smaller budget, inspired by Fox's success with Deadpool and Logan (even though Venom was released under the PG-13 rating).
Before Deadpool's release, Fox green-lit a sequel with Reese and Wernick returning to write the screenplay.
Reese and Wernick returning to write the screenplay.
